intro: Minuartia arctica, commonly known as the arctic mouse-ear, is a low-growing, mat-forming plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and clusters of white or pink flowers. The plant thrives in cold, rocky environments and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions. It plays a crucial role in stabilizing soil in its native habitats. Minuartia arctica is also known for its ability to survive in low-nutrient soils and is often found in tundra and mountainous areas.
